text: Came here with my sister fir the grilled oysters!! They did not disappoint!! Flavorful , hot and tasty!! We also got oysters on the half shell - sweet, juicy with perfectly heated cocktail sauce!! And etoufee which was the BOMB!! Hit the spot especially with a beer and American mule!! Needed to save room for dinner so we controlled ourselves! Went to Mambo's last night and this place crushes it!! Come here first!!

I wasn't able to dine at ACME on my last visit. The lines were so long. But this time, when I arrived, there was a long line. I told the host that, I was alone and if there was bar seating available. He went to check and BAM! I was seated. Everything on the menu looked so delicious. And let me tell you it was!! The food was hot, fresh and very flavorful! The bartender was cool as well. I was allowed to stay longer than I expected, as I was waiting for friends to finish up elsewhere. This will be a DEFINITE place, that I will return to!

Fantastic oysters and service. Ask for Garrett to be your server. Our group ordered a dozen of the grilled and a dozen raw paired with some Anita beers. They serve other dishes there too but we went for the oysters only. Enjoy!

This is always one of my go to places when in New Orleans or Destin Florida the food is always consistently good.  The charbroiled oysters are a must and the onion rings are delicious. Don't leave with out trying the bread pudding it is delicious.

My GAWD, the char broiled oysters we're heaven!!! And I didn't even want to try them for the first time, greatest food descision I ever made!!

Line is long but goes by fast, just enjoy your company!

Don't order a half dozen, just do yourself a favor and order a full dozen char broiled oysters... For yourself.

These were the best oysters I had in New Orleans.
I usually go for the raw oysters but I'm now converted thanks to Acme Oyster House. Watching them being prepared on the grill is an experience in itself. The butter beans were a must have as well.

Yes, there will be long lines, and Yes, it is more than just a little touristy, and Yes, while standing in line you may begin to wonder if it will be worth it once you get inside, and I can answer that last one with a resounding Daniel Bryan sized YES YES YES, as this place definitely lived up to expectations, as the oysters were succulent, the drinks were made just right and the service was friendly with a sincere down home friendliness that you don't find at many places anymore.   

Highly recommend you ignore those who say it isn't worth waiting for, because it is without a doubt worth every minute you may have to wait in that line, so what are you waiting for, go get yourself some oysters!

Came here 2x and was not disappointed! The oysters were AMAZING! My first time having them and they did not disappoint! Also the seafood gumbo, red beans n rice, the sausage, and the jambalaya was GREAT! Our server Tyrus was attentive the entire evening, my glass never went dry! On day 2 of returning, he placed my order w/o me telling him and he brought my drink prior to me asking! He doesn't forget his customers! Thank you for a GREAT experience Tyrus!

Went at an off time and we were seated right away (after showing vaccine cards with IDs). We had a sausage po'boy, a fried fish po'boy, craw puppies and boo fries. All of it was good, but my favorite was definitely the boo fries - don't miss out on these. Definitely would go back and recommend. It was small, dim and bustling inside. Service was great and the menu has just a bit of everything.
Best chargrilled oysters in French Quarters, worth seating at the bar and seeing how they crack open those shells. The Chipotle Tabasco go great with the oysters as recommended...

I love the Acme Oyster House, but with over 7,500 reviews, there is not much I can say that hasn't already been said.  So I'll keep it short, and just touch on the highlights. 

Some people complain about long lines.  We were fortunate and did not have a line.  But even if there is a line...the food is worth it.  

I had the Peace Maker Po-Boy (oysters and shrimp) and added grilled onions.    It was delicious.  My wife had the Acme Special Po-Boy and declared it the best Po-Boy she's ever had.  We had a side of very tasty Hush Puppies.  I also enjoyed an oyster shooter.  

Service was friendly and flawless.  

It's a little touristy, but I can't ding them for that.  The Acme Oyster House has been around for over 100 years...  I think that's all you really need to know.

Just an amazing experience. The staff there take so much pride in their product and delivery. On top of that the food is great. Tried some raw oysters, chargrilled oysters and craw puppies. Theres a good reason why this place has existed for over 100 years

We were recently in Gulf Shores, AL and decided to go to Acme Oyster House.  Of course, being a cajun restaurant, they use cajun seasonings.  I have food allergies, so there was very little I could eat.  However, my husband had the gumbo, and he said it was very good.  The management was very kind to let me know they use Tony Chachere's seasoning, which is definitely full of msg.  They are unable to prepare certain foods for those of us who have allergies because they get everything from corporate and corporate wants everyone to have the same experience at all of their restaurant locations.  It is a fun place, the food smells yummy, but unfortunately we will not go back because they cannot accommodate folks with food allergies.

Another must-try spot just off Bourbon Street in the French Quarter.  Full service, sitdown restaurant.  We went for dinner on a Friday and had to wait around 15 minutes to be seated.  They required proof of COVID vaccination or recent negative test as of November 2021.  Fast and friendly service!

I know it's in the name of the restaurant, but I've never really given oysters a chance.  My fam convinced me to try chargrilled oysters and I'm glad I did.  If you're iffy like me, get them cooked as opposed to raw.  They're drowned in other flavors like butter and herbs, and I found myself going back for more.  For my main course, I got the New Orleans Medley, which is a sampling of gumbo, jambalaya, red beans & rice and grilled smoked sausage.  I highly recommend it, as I like trying a little bit of a lot of stuff!

This is a must try place in the French Quarter. We had excellent service from Audrey. The prickly pear margarita was amazing. For an appetizer, we got the fried crawfish tails, they were great. I got the soft crab po'boy, my husband got the seafood platter with fish, oysters and shrimp. Food was delicious. We will definitely come back next time!

Good Food, Nice People. Very busy for dinner and very loud! 
Prices are good as well.

We got the Shrimp po boy, and char grilled oysters - and if you're not an oyster person you will be after eating these. Gumbo was delicious. Wasn't sure what to order and waitress suggested the char broiled oysters and they were fantastic. In fact they were so good We had to order more. So delicious! There was a longish line, but I think it's worth the wait. The staff was nice and accommodating. Great place to eat!
Casual good eats! A classic go to spot for oysters, charbroiled oysters, fried shrimp, fish, and hush puppies.

Nothing said that hasn't already been said. Mike was an AMAZING server and deserves many accolade's. Treated us like we were long time guest although it was our first visit. Where do you find these ppl? Good guy, amazing food and great times. Hope to come back soon!

Seafood gumbo and garlic and butter cooked oysters to die for.
A must visit on trip to NOLA.
The oysters was lit.  I tried a few other items and they were not as good. I will only order the oysters.... Specifically the CHARGRILLED!!! I will be back just for those!!

This is a must go place. My favorite chargrilled oysters. You can dip the bread in the buttery sauce. 
Also I suggest adding fried crayfish to the etouffe! We went early to avoid he lines
You can never go wrong here! You may have a wait but it's worth it! You have to get the Bread Pudding before you leave !  The staff members are professional and informative!

Used to love this place but will never come here again. First, the party in front of us "couldn't find their vaccination card" and kept "looking" for it. Instead of refusing them entry they still let them in. Then once seated didn't want one part of a sampler and wanted something substituted.  They refused so refused to eat anything. Screw you Acme with your double standards and crappy customer service.

I didn't have a terrible experience, however, it's wasn't the best either. In my opinion the restaurant simply didn't live up to the hype. I'm honestly not sure why it's highly recommended because their wasn't anything on the menu that stood out from other places I've visited. The service was good and the food was decent.

Acme Oyster House is one of my go-to's in NOLA. We went around noon on a Sunday. To my surprise there wasn't a line wrapped around the corner. We were seated within 10 minutes (at the bar, which was fine). The lady taking our order was pretty good. She was accommodating and quick. The service was quick and the food was consistent with my past experiences there. Everything was delicious.

You can't visit New Orleans without visiting Acme's! The wait is incredibly long, so be sure to get there an hour or two before you are ready to eat. But the food is definitely worth the wait.

We got the shrimp and oyster po-boy (Peacemaker Po-Boy), char-grilled oysters, fresh oysters, soft-shell crab and jambalaya. Everything was amazing, the fresh oysters were amazing!!!

Make sure to get oyster shooters while you're here.

Wonderful variety of foods tailored to the New Orleans atmosphere. A cozy, friendly environment tucked away in the French Quarter that garnered a lot of attention, and rightly so. I got a fried soft shell crab, and a regular crab cake, both of which nearly indescribably delicious. My only critique was the sauce, which I can't complain much about anyways because I don't like sauces in general. But from where I've gotten crab cakes before, those places put étouffée on top, a wonderful addition, which this restaurant did not have.

The real deal. Good food. Stiff drinks. Staff that knows what it is doing and cares to make sure customers are happy without ever being obsequious. Oysters are shucked to order and come out moist and fresh. Good gumbo. Good shrimp and grits. Very up and positive vibe. Sit at the bar! Say hi to Gary!

I have to say the chargrilled oysters were so good we kept ordering for more. Our server Mike was excellent, very attentive, courteous and helpful on deciding what we can get the biggest ban for the buck. I was very impressed for the overall experience in a restaurant that is so busy in the heart of a tourist area.
Just the best.... we start our French Quarter crawl here everyday.  Friendly service, delicious food and Andygator in tap!
Great service at the bar the female was so friendly we talked about cats.  I enjoy coming and sitting at the bar for a great conversation. The food as always very spectacular.

Acmes was the first place we ate at in new orleans! The line was long but it was worth the wait. We got chargrilled oysters to start and the flavor was great! Disappointed in the size of them but i know that sometimes cannot be helped. We also did not really like the server service :( in the beginning he was snappy but he lighten up towards the end! For my entree I got the seafood platter. I did not expect it to be that much food but it was!! The fried oysters were my favorite part!! The seasoning was sooooo good. I would definitely come back! If you're in downtown new orleans, I would go stop in!
The food was amazing! Everything about this place is magical! Every time I'm in NOLA, I will come back! A-1 Certified!

Yes it is absolutely worth the wait! The food was spectacular! The service was great and we had a great time! We started dinner off with some vodka oyster shooters to warm us up, then of course we had to try the sampler to get a good taste of New Orleans staples, followed by a combo of the fresh and chargrilled oysters. The oysters in New Orleans are amazing and at Acme, they are just incomparable! The Bloody Mary's are also specially made there and so delicious!
Excellent oysters and Po-Boys.  Yes was a wait, but service was excellent and drinks served up cold and delicious.

After looking at the hours online we went to the restaurant at 7:00 pm on New Years Day. The line was shorter than expected which should have been the first red flag. 

When we were up next to be seated the host came out to tell us they were no longer serving raw or chargrilled oysters. As we stood there scratching our heads we saw several people inside eating raw and chargrilled oysters. 

We were seated and sure enough, they told us they weren't serving them. We ordered our food and it came out pretty quick. 

While we were waiting for our food, the guy working the oyster bar told us the manager decided to stop selling oysters so the employees could get out of there quicker since it's been a long day for them. They were also closing 2 hours earlier than their sign, Google, and their website said. 

This was such a disappointing visit. We understand it was a holiday, but it's unacceptable to stop selling your namesake just to get your employees out earlier. There are way too many other restaurants to choose from to be treated like this.
Amazing oysters love the garlic buttery preparation. This is unique of New Orleans you have to try it.

Missed this place on the last trip to NOLA, so had to make sure we made it this time.   Glad we did.   Short wait outside to sit at the bar and it was worth it.  We had raw oysters, oyster shooter, and chargrilled oysters.  Everything was excellent.

It is an icon in NOLA, and it shows.  We had chargrilled oysters in many places in NOLA and I have to say this place is my favorite.  Lots of places in the area are good, but ACME has the best chargrilled flavor.   You taste the oyster, butter, and garlic as well.   Other places are a little heavy on the parm or garlic.   These were on point!

I even bought an ACME koozie for my beer.  Highly recommended.
Sit at the bar if you can...the servers and bartenders are fun and friendly. Oysters Rockefeller are the best!
Char-Boyed oysters are the best thing. You should sit at the bar. You'll get seated right away. Customer service is good. No complaints..

The chargrilled oysters are reason enough to wait in line to dine here. This particular evening I wanted something different. I found the deep fried crab specifically delicious, very well done, tasty. 

As usual, I arrived with my entourage. It's not easy to seat and serve so many but I'm really thankful they took such good care of us!
Fast service.  Classic oyster house.  Shrimp was very fresh and delicious.   Some people say is a  tourist tramp, but they are great at what they do.

This place does have a wait and there will be a line but it seems to move quickly. We were seated at the bar with Gary who was knowledgeable, quick and friendly. We started out with the boom boom shrimp and it was so good! Then we ordered chargrilled oysters and raw oysters. Both were delicious however I will say I was impressed with the chargrilled oysters. Gary recommended the chargrilled oysters and I'm so glad we took his recommendation. I ordered the fried shrimp Po-Boy with a cup of seafood gumbo, both were great! Their shrimp is lightly battered and seasoned with great taste. Finished off our dinner with their banana foster cheesecake. If you love banana cream pie and cheesecake, order this! Highly recommend this spot for dinner.

Came here because my friend had researched and heard amazing things about this place--we're visiting from Los Angeles. 

We ordered:

Charbroiled oysters - I found the butter and parm-tasting cheese to be really overpowering and heavy. Lacked depth of flavor (there were some other great oyster places we tried that were yummier) and mostly just salty. 2/10

Raw oysters - these tasted just okay and were shucked kind of messily so I was spitting out pieces of shell and tasting grime. Standard horseradish sauce with two tiny pieces of lemon per platter. 4/10

Seafood etouffee - pretty good (can't go wrong with tomato and cream) but salty. We added the fried crawfish, and the fried pieces were tiny and mostly batter. 6/10

New Orleans medley - sausage was kind of dry, seafood gumbo was really yummy as was the jambalaya, and the beans and rice had nice chunks of meat in it. Overall pretty good save for the sausage, but I again feel that there are better places to go for these dishes. 7/10

Soup of the day - on 1/16/2022 it was corn and crab chowder. Was okay but still a little too salty for my taste. 5/10

Overall this place is heavy on salt and grease and primarily relies on those two facets for taste. The staff are amazing and service is great. I think there are better places to go for oysters.
